Record.ClassificationPath: Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Pharmacologic Substance/Antineoplastic Agent/Antimitotic Agent/Tubulin Binding Agent/Estramustine Phosphate Sodium,/NCIThesaurus/Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Pharmacologic Substance/Antineoplastic Agent/Alkylating Agent/Antineoplastic Alkylating Agent/Mustard Agent/Nitrogen Mustard Compound/Estramustine Phosphate Sodium
Record.BroaderTerm: Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material
Record.Description: The orally available disodium salt, monohydrate, of estramustine phosphate, a synthetic molecule that combines estradiol and nornitrogen mustard through a carbamate link. Estramustine and its major metabolite estramustine bind to microtubule-associated proteins (MAPs) and tubulin, thereby inhibiting microtubule dynamics and leading to anaphase arrest in a dose-dependent fashion. This agent also exhibits anti-androgenic effects.
